newsitem.title: ETHIOPIA: Sweden gives Ethiopia $26 million for development.
newsitem.headline: Sweden gives Ethiopia $26 million for development.

text.p: Sweden gave Ethiopia a $26.47 million grant on Thursday for rural development in the northern Amhara Region, the state-run Ethiopian News Agency reported.
It said that $25.18 million of the grant would be used to alleviate poverty among the rural population in the region through sustainable increases in agricultural productivity.
It will finance projects such as a rural credit scheme, building rural roads and training programmes.
The remaining $1.29 million will be used to strengthen the capacity of Ethiopia's civil service in planning and implementing development programmes, the agency said.
The grant was part of the 1996 development cooperation agreement between the two countries, it added.
